page.title: 02THE LOCAL AREA
page.content: OUR SQUARE IS COVERED BY ARABLE FARMLAND AND IS LOW LYING AND FLAT. THE RIVER TRENT FLOWS THROUGH THE SQUARE FROM SOUTH TO NORTH AND THE HIGHLY PRODUCTIVE NATURE OF THE SOIL OWES MUCH TO THE SILT LEFT BY THE RIVER. NOW THE RIVER IS CONTAINED BEHIND A HIGH BANK AND FLOODING IS NO LONGER A PROBLEM. THE CUSTOM OF WARPING (ALLOWING THE RIVER TO FLOOD AND LEAVE DEPOSITS OF RICH MUD) IS NO LONGER PRACTISED. THERE ARE FOUR SETTLEMENTS IN THE AREA; WEST BUTTERWICK WITH A POPULATION OF 680; EAST BUTTERWICK AND BELTOFT WITH ABOUT 150 EACH AND OUTMILL WITH AROUND 20. THERE ARE SOME ISOLATED FARMS AND A FEW SMALL AREAS OF WOODLAND. THE SQUARE IS CROSSED BY TWO NATURAL GAS PIPES AND ELECTRICITY SUPPLY LINES ON PYLONS. THE AREA IS COVERED BY NUMEROUS DRAINS AND DYKES.
